nodes.bodyText: I think it's a bit confusing that the example is using :remote console although the text only explains the :> variant to send commands to the server. So I would either actually use :> first and then explain :remote console afterwards or directly explain :remote console here as a convenient variant to send all commands to the server instead of having to prefix all commands with :>.

nodes.bodyText: I know we had this link here before already, but it's best to use {{ tinkerpop_version }} instead of current in links to TinkerPop docs to make them always point to the correct version of the TinkerPop docs.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -105,8 +102,18 @@ gremlin> graph.addVertex("name", user)
 No such property: user for class: Script21
 Type ':help' or ':h' for help.
 Display stack trace? [yN]
+```
+
+Alternately, you can establish a consolewith a session by specifying
+[session](https://tinkerpop.apache.org/docs/current/reference/#sessions)
+when creating the connection. A [console
+session](https://tinkerpop.apache.org/docs/current/reference/#console-sessions)

nodes.bodyText:
Me neither, so i decided to leave this sentence untouched even though I was confused, too.
I just looked it up and "alternately" is more suitable for the meaning of two things that are alternating.
Changed it to "alternatively" now.
